text: This article lists the most distant things known to us, all of which are galaxies or energy sources inside galaxies. Their distances are described in two ways. redshift = z, and billion light years (Gly). As of 2012, there are only about 50 possible objects z=8 or farther, and another 100 z=7 candidates.FirstGalaxies, Our latest results Candidates vary in their notability, so not everything is included here. 1 Gly = 1 billion light-years = 109 ly.
